text: I'm Andrew Knowlton restaurant and
drinks editor at bon appetit and today
I'm going to show you how to make a
classic Ramos Gin Fizz the cool thing
about this cocktail has egg whites in it
don't be afraid trust me it's really
easy to make and it's delicious here's
how it's done
first you're gonna need a Boston shaker
which I have here two ounces of gin the
cool thing about this drink is it was
invented in the 1880s in New Orleans by
Henry Ramos at a restaurant called Myers
restaurant and the story goes he called
to shake it for 13 minutes and you can
imagine doing that for 13 minutes you
get tired so he used to line up 20
bartenders and they would just pass it
down we have our gin 1/2 ounce of lemon
juice 1/2 ounce of lime juice bounce and
a quarter of simple syrup then we're
gonna add a little bit heavy cream and
then we're gonna use the egg white which
every Ramos Gin Fizz has I have a fresh
farm egg that we got at the farmers
market this morning that's what I would
recommend using you can certainly buy
pasteurized egg whites that's cool too
so then there goes the egg white and
this is gonna create an amazing kind of
foam on this drink in with the ice I'm
gonna shake this probably about a minute
just to really incorporate that egg
whites
all right so then we're gonna serve this
in a Collins glass and put some ice in
it not too much ice put our Hawthorne
strainer should be nice and foamy white
and then we're just gonna top it off
with a little bit of club soda and in
New Orleans when they do this they'll
let it fall around the sides I won't
make a mess and then essential garnish
is just a orange wheel too for Flair and
there you go there's a authentic Ramos
Gin Fizz it's pretty great for these
cocktail recipes and more go to Bon
Appetit calm a wonderful brunch drink
great for a brunch and you'll love it
for brunch here's how it's done
